title: What is the structure of internal telephone exchange? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thanks for the question. Stored Program Control (SPC) Switches, or Telephone Exchange, are characterised by:- - Controlling Application Software- Time-Space-Time Switch for connecting incoming and outgoing "Time-Slots"- Processor (Hardware)- Digital Signalling (e.g. C7, SS7, etc..)- Charging / Accounting for the usage of Resources, i.e. generating Charging Data Records/Toll Tickets, Event Data Records, etc.. for Billing- Input / Output (I/O) for Operational and Maintenance- ISDN (I.420 / I.421) Capabilities- Advanced Customer Features (e.g. Centrex, CLIP, CLIR, Three Party Calls, Call Forwarding based on Conditions, etc..)- Operation / Maintenance Functions SPC Switches have stood the test of time. Now with Data-Centers, SDN, NFV, IP, 3GPP IMS, SD-WAN, etc.. another cross-roads is being experienced that is similar to the move from Analog to Digital systems. Reference: Stored Program Control
